intro: Litobrochia mexicana, commonly known as the Mexican lithobryum, is a small, mat-forming liverwort found in arid and rocky environments. It belongs to the family Pottiaceae and is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth habit. The plant has a dark green, leathery appearance with closely packed leaves that are often covered in a layer of fine, waxy cells. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in desert regions of Mexico. Due to its specialized habitat, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native range.
